SENT.plain: A 4 1/2-year-old girl presented with cervical spine and radicular pain with hypoactive biceps and brachioradialis stretch reflexes
A diagnosis of pseudotumor cerebri was made
The patient's symptoms resolved following the reduction of the elevated intracranial pressure
Abnormalities of the cervical spine and spinal cord were not detected
A mechanism to explain this "false localizing" sign is discussed
